page.title: 19Interviews II
page.content: Sutton Benger pupils interviewed Miss Gladys Heath, age 89, the oldest inhabitant to have been born in the village. After leaving school she went into service as a laundry maid, earning Â£23 per year working for Lord Cowley on the Draycot Estate. She remembers the piped water supply and electricity coming to the village, but still prefers the old ways. "The well in the front garden did not freeze in winter the way that pipes do." Memories of World War II reveal that, apart from having some evacuees in the village, it had little effect on daily life. Food rationing had a limited impact as locals could obtain pheasants from Draycot Park, as well as growing their own vegetables.
